explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA C Rule 2.1 prohibits unreachable code that is present in the built project (i.e. code that is part of the translation unit but can never be executed at run time). The WSASend block in send_iov_nontls is guarded by preprocessor conditionals (#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)) and therefore is not part of the translation unit when HAVE_SENDMSG is defined; it is simply excluded by conditional compilation. That fragment can be compiled and executed in other build configurations where MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS is defined, so it is not unreachable code in the project as a whole. The empty test log simply indicates the test run did not invoke this function (or the logging path), not that the code is unreachable in the sense of MISRA 2.1. Therefore Agent A’s claim of a Rule 2.1 violation is incorrect.
